Author: iaminsideboi
Content:
Chat how would this work
Every province is headed by a raja, bupati, adipati or ketua adat, but DPRD still exist. Negara federasi meaning more autonomi daerah (would this solve secessionist problem?) On a national level maybe there would still be a prwsident?

Author: felix_white_law_12319
Content: Yo

Author: felix_white_law_12319
Content: Malaysia did this before

Author: felix_white_law_12319
Content: 9/13 Malay states were controlled by monarchs

Author: felix_white_law_12319
Content: In my opinion Some region like  Yogyakarta, Surakarta and East Sumatera should be led by monarchs

Author: felix_white_law_12319
Content: While the rest is led by original governors and elected for 6 years

Author: mahakardus
Content: there should be an attempt to bring back traditional institutions as a counter balance to the state honestly

Content: and currently is the right time

Author: mahakardus
Content: but it requires the fundamental recognition that indonesia is not a one nation, but made up of nations. if not, the existence of such institutions will be seen as redundant and they keep imposing the usual democratic institutions as the only legitimate for everyone

Content: True, that is important
